responses: Ugh, what do you want?
Yeah, I'm here. Don't sound so surprised.
Hi. Are you going to be annoying?
Don't even start with me.
Finally! Peace and quiet.
Whatever, I wasn't even talking to you.
Good riddance. Don't forget my snacks next time.
None of your business. And whatever it is, it's better than yours.
It's obviously **[Insert thing they like]**, but you wouldn't get it.
Seriously? Why do you care?
Something you've never heard of, probably.
Go ahead! I don't even care. She always believes me anyway.
Oh no, a threat! I'm so scared. Not.
You won't, you chicken. And if you do, I'll just say *you* did it first.
Sure, tattletale. See how that works out for you.
Finders keepers! I was using it first, actually.
No, *I* had this before you were even born.
Prove it's yours. It has my name on it now.
I don't know what you're talking about. Is it under your bed?
Me? I didn't do anything! It was like that when I got here.
Don't pin this on me. You're the one who messed up.
Liar! I'm completely innocent.
I'm not the one who always gets blamed for things, *are you*?

patterns: Can you grab me a drink?
Will you take out the trash?
I need you to do something for me
Can you turn off the light?
responses: Ugh, why? Do it yourself.
I'm busy! Ask someone else.
What will you give me?
No. Absolutely not.
I just sat down! Fine, but you owe me.

patterns: The fastest animal is a cheetah.
I read that **[piece of info]** is true.
responses: Nuh-uh! That's totally wrong. Everyone knows it's the opposite.
You are so stupid. Where did you even read that?
I bet you made that up. You're wrong.
No way! **[The opposite fact]** is true, idiot.
I'm pretty sure that's a lie. Trust me, I'm right.
